gw.plugin.purge

Interface PurgePlugin

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin, java.rmi.Remote

    public interface PurgePlugin
extends com.guidewire.pl.system.integration.plugins.internal.InternalPlugin
    Plugin used to configure PolicyCenter purging. This includes determining whether a PolicyPeriod or other purgeable entities should be added to work queue for purging.

    • Method Detail

      • skipOrphanedPolicyPeriodForPurge

        boolean skipOrphanedPolicyPeriodForPurge(PolicyPeriod purgeCandidate)
        Determine if the purgeCandidate should be skipped for purging or not
        Parameters:
        purgeCandidate - an orphaned policy period candidate to evaluate for purging
        Returns:
        false if the candidate is acceptable for purging, true otherwise

      • skipPolicyPeriodForPurge

        boolean skipPolicyPeriodForPurge(PolicyPeriod purgeCandidate)
        Determine if the purgeCandidate should be skipped for purging or not
        Parameters:
        purgeCandidate - policy period candidate to evaluate for purging
        Returns:
        false if the candidate is acceptable for purging, true otherwise

        Allocate and return an extended @{link PurgeContext}.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The system purge context or an extended purge context.

      • prepareForPurge

        void prepareForPurge(PurgeContext context)
        Pre-purge extension hook. Other than logging or gathering statistics, Guidewire recommends that only a minimal amount of changes occur in the prepareForPurge method.
        Parameters:
        context - specifies what is to be purged

      • postPurge

        void postPurge(PurgeContext context)
        Post-purge extension hook.
        Parameters:
        context - from prepareForPurge

      • getAllowedJobSubtypesForPruning

        java.util.List<Job> getAllowedJobSubtypesForPruning()
        Returns:
        a list of allowed Job types which can be candidates to be pruned Pruning refers to removing all unselected versions associated with a job

      • getAllowedJobSubtypesForPurging

        java.util.List<Job> getAllowedJobSubtypesForPurging()
        Returns:
        a list of allowed Job types which can be candidates to be purged

      • calculateNextPurgeCheckDate

        java.util.Date calculateNextPurgeCheckDate(Job job)
        Parameters:
        job - the Job under consideration for purging.
        Returns:
        The date to next evaluate this Job for purging. If null, purging should be checked at the next opportunity.

      • getPurgeJobDate

        java.util.Date getPurgeJobDate(Job job)
        Determine the date on or after which the given Job should be purged. If the current date is on or after the returned value, the job will be purged
        Parameters:
        job - the Job under consideration for purging.
        Returns:
        The date on or after which the Job is a candidate for purging.

      • getPruneJobDate

        java.util.Date getPruneJobDate(Job job)
        Determine the date on or after which the given job should have unselected policy periods purged. If the current date is on or after the returned value, the unselected PolicyPeriods will be purged from the Job
        Parameters:
        job - the Job under consideration for purging.
        Returns:
        The date on or after which the Job is a candidate for having unselected policy periods purged.

      • disablePurgingArchivedPolicyPeriods

        boolean disablePurgingArchivedPolicyPeriods()
        Returns true if the purging of archived PolicyPeriods is disabled. For any routine deployment, this should return true (purge from archive is disabled). At this time, Guidewire does not support purging from archive with this feature. Purging from archive is completely untested and may result in unexpected data loss, performance issues, and/or data corruption. This method has only been exposed to field configuration for use in the extraordinary case that all the implications of enabling it have been thoroughly examined by the field team and customer, all are aware of the risks, and accept those risks.
        Returns:
        true if the purging of Archived PolicyPeriods is disabled
